Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2012 07:46PM summersong wrote: I am sweetbean's sister and when we went for the MRI today, the nodule was still there but he couldn't do the biopsy because it was so close to the skin. (Basically, to grab some of the nodule he would have blown a dime-size hole in my skin. It was close.) So now I have an appt with the surgeon tomorrow to plan a surgical biopsy.
Posts.Title: My sister has a lump - needs biopsy sweetbean sweetbean

Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2012 10:32PM summersong wrote: Even among high risk women like us, on 12 % of biopsies caused by questionable MRI results are actually cancer. My twin was diagnosed 18 months ago and I just had a surgical biopsy today. When she told me that, I definitely breathed easier.
Posts.Title: Biopsy Tomorrow - Strong Family History - Scared howhm02l Beckers

Posts.Content: Jul 7, 2012 10:23AM summersong wrote: I had the surgical biopsy about 10 days ago and have had a similar experience- the pain got worse about a week in. My nipple is especially sore- like how I remember from nursing. (my results came back benign-yay! ) With a strong family history, I worry that this won't be the last biopsy and I kind of want to get a handle on the healing. I am using an essential oil that my sister gave me. She said it could be referred pain but I wonder if it is just from wearing a sports bra all the time. Has anyone else experienced this?
